chicken biryani recipe with video step by step photos biryani is one of
the most amazing royal delicacies introduced to indians by the persians since
then it has been much popular and is considered to be a luxurious treat to
enjoy on special occasions making a chicken biryani in authentic dum style
does take some time and needs little expertise
chicken biryani served in a white
traditional chicken biryani is made by layering marinated chicken at the
bottom of a pot followed by another layer of par cooked rice herbs saffron
infused milk ghee i have shared that traditional hyderabadi biryani
the recipe shared here in this post details a short cut method to make a
simple one pot delicious chicken biryani that you can make in a pressure
so what i have shared in this post is not a dum style biriyani yet it will
surprise you with a good aroma and taste
this recipe yields a chicken biryani that isn t too oily spicy hot or
pungent as it looks to be in the pictures however you can reduce the amount
of red chili powder if you do not prefer the heat this is best served with a
you can also find the old version of this chicken biryani recipe towards the
end of this post as recipe 2
how to make chicken biryani stepwise photos
1 this recipe needs half kg chicken 11 lbs make few slits on all the
chicken pieces and add to a large bowl then add
to 1 tablespoon garam masala or biriyani masala
to 1 teaspoon red chili powder reduce for kids

4 heat ghee or oil in a heavy bottom pot or pressure cooker make sure you
use a large one for this using whole spices is optional but recommended use
frying spices in pot to make chicken
5 add thinly sliced onions on a medium heat fry them stirring often until
6 this is the correct color of the onions do not burn them as they leave a
7 add marinated chicken saute until it becomes pale for 5 minutes
8 lower the flame completely cover and cook until the chicken is soft
9 check if the chicken is cooked by pricking with a fork or knife it has to
be just cooked and not overdone evaporate any excess moisture left in the pot
by cooking further without the lid

to teaspoon red chili powder optional
adding curd spices to make chicken
11 mix everything well spread it evenly in a single layer
layering the marinade in pot to make chicken
12 layer drained rice all over the chicken to a separate bowl pour 3 cups
water and add to teaspoon salt if cooking in a pot start with 3 cups
stir and taste the water it must be slightly salty pour 2 cups of this
across the sides of the cooker or pot pour rest of the water over the rice
layering rice and pouring water to make chicken
13 level the rice gently on top add 2 tablespoons more mint leavesdo not
mix up everything the taste of the biryani cooked in the shown method is
good optionally you can sprinkle 2 tablespoons fried onions saffron soaked
14 finally cover the pot or cooker
if cooking in a pot cook on a medium heat until the rice is done
completely if the rice is undercooked pour to cup boiling water at this
stage how much to add depends on the quality of basmati rice cook covered
until the biryani rice is perfectly done grainy and fully cooked rest it
if cooking in a cooker cook for 1 whistle later remove the cooker from
the hot burner to stop cooking further
15 when the pressure releases naturally open the lid gently fluff up with

serve chicken biryani in layers top layer with rice and bottom layer with

towards the end if the rice is under cooked you can sprinkle little hot water
what you need for a good biryani
to make a good biryani always use best quality ingredients the choice of
good quality basmati rice whole spices spice powders chicken ghee all
contribute to the flavors of chicken biryani

1 basmati rice there are so many kinds of basmati rice available in the market for best results choose premium quality basmati rice that is labelled as aged this kind of rice is more firm fluffs up well in chicken biryani without turning mushy aged rice is also more fragrant
though this biryani is made in a pressure cooker or pot the texture of rice
grains will come out right without getting mushy if made with aged rice
2 biryani masala spices good quality whole spices spice powders elevate the flavor of chicken biryani so choose a good quality ready made garam masala powder or biryani masala
i am also sharing the ingredients for an instant biriyani masala powder if
you do not have a ready made or store bought masala you can make it in just

3 chicken we usually use up the cut whole chicken to make the chicken biryani however i always find chicken breast pieces dry out if not marinated well with yogurt if you prefer soft tender succulent pieces of chicken in your biryani then just use chicken thighs drumsticks
always use bone in chicken as it helps the dish to turn out more flavorful
4 ghee traditionally chicken biryani was made using ghee since this recipe does not follow the traditional method you can also make it using oil but ghee adds a unique aroma to the dish
how to make the best chicken biryani

marination marinating chicken with yogurt spices is the first key step to make the best chicken biryani yogurt tenderizes the chicken the spices enhance the flavors marinating and resting chicken makes it soft succulent so do not skip that if you do not eat curd then can substitute it with coconut milk

preparing rice basmati rice has to be rinsed very well a few times in ample amount of water to get rid of the starch this prevents the rice grains from turning mushy soaking the rice helps to cook the rice grains to fluffy long so do not skip rinsing soaking the rice well before using

water this recipe uses plain water to cook the chicken biryani however it can be replaced with coconut milk or chicken stock the quantity of water i have mentioned in the recipe card works well for me with lalquilla old malai basmati rice this ratio works pretty well with any aged basmati rice
please do adjust the amount of heat in the recipe my recipes are usually low on heat for the indian taste buds since i have young kids at home these levels work well for us

pot method if cooking in a pot cover and cook on a low flame until the
chicken biryani is done to your liking if the rice is still under cooked or
hard pour to cup boiling water and cook further when done it has to be
cooker method set the flame to medium high cover place the whistle
cook for 1 whistle move the cooker away from the burner to stop cooking
rest until the pressure settles fluff up the chicken biryani with a fork
serve from top to the bottom layer each serving gets biryani rice from top
and chicken from the bottom layer
enjoy chicken biryani with raita and sliced veggies papad and shorba

1 water the amount of water to use depends on the brand of basmati rice not all basmati rice need the same amount of water so for pot method start with 3 cups water towards the end if the rice is undercooked pour to cup boiling water and cook further you will need to experiment a bit with the right amount here

2 tomatoes an authentic biryani never uses tomatoes so i have not used in the recipe it does not add any taste infact alters the flavor if you still want to use you an follow the second recipe i have posted below
3 to make biryani masala or garam masala powder together very small piece of nutmeg 5 cardamoms tsp pepper 5 cloves 1 to 2 inch cinnamon tsp fennel seeds tsp stone flower
4 yogurt or curd do not use sour curd if the curd is slightly sour then skip using lemon juice
5 rice i have used lalquilla basmati rice old malai any other basmati rice may need less or more water make sure to use as needed

this is the old version of the same chicken biryani many readers have been
following since 2012 upon getting several requests i have updated it here
tsp red chilli powder / lal mirch powder
to tsp biryani masala or garam masala powder
3 cups water or thin coconut milk if using normal rice use little more
2 green chilies / hari mirch sliced or chopped
or use 2 tsps readymade biryani masala or garam masala
to tsp pepper corn / kali mirch
tsp stone flower / dagad phool/ kalapasi optional
1 soak rice for at least 20 to 30 minutes if using normal rice not basmati soak it for 30 minutes
2 marinate chicken using ingredients under marination set this aside
1 add oil to a pot or pressure cooker and heat it next add the dry spices and saute till they begin to sizzle
2 add onions and fry till they turn golden fry ginger garlic paste till the raw smell goes off
3 next add chicken and fry till the color slightly changes to pale
4 add chopped tomatoes yogurt red chili powder corinader leaves and mint
5 cook till the mixture turns thick and dry by now the chicken should be almost cooked soft
6 add the rest of the masala powder and fry till you get a nice smell

7 mix together water or thin coconut milk and salt in a separate bowl check the salt it must be slightly salty since salt is already added to marination use little only pour this to a the chicken pot bring it to a boil
1 drain off the rice completely and add it to the pot or cooker

2 cook till the water very little is left cover the pot or pressure cooker with a lid turn on the flame to very low if using basmati rice cook it for about 3 to 5 minutes do not let it whistle or if using normal rice that is slightly on the harder side to cook allow it to whistle once if cooking in pot cook until the rice is done next if rice is under cooked you can also sprinkle little water and cook further
3 let the pressure go down fluff up the rice with a fork or transfer it immediately to a wide utensil to prevent turning mushy
4 if desired you can drizzle one spoon of ghee coriander leaves and roasted boiled eggs
5 serve pressure cooker chicken biryani with onion raita or biryani shorba or sherva
do not use thick coconut milk it will split you can dilute thick coconut
